Sentencas: This paper develops a model for the study of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) electrical efficiency.
Titulo: Large limits of electrical efficiency in hydrocarbon fueled SOFCs

Sentencas: The chemically reacting flow model considers the coupled behavior of fluid mechanics, thermodynamic equilibrium, and transport of electroactive species through the electrolyte.
Titulo: Large limits of electrical efficiency in hydrocarbon fueled SOFCs

Sentencas: Fuel cells are treated as plug flow tubular reactors with no upstream diffusion.
Titulo: Large limits of electrical efficiency in hydrocarbon fueled SOFCs

Sentencas: Minimization of free energy is used to calculate gas composition along the length of the fuel channel without specifying a set of reactions.
Titulo: Large limits of electrical efficiency in hydrocarbon fueled SOFCs

Sentencas: The model serves to place an upper bound on electrical efficiencies.
Titulo: Large limits of electrical efficiency in hydrocarbon fueled SOFCs

Sentencas: The usefulness of the model is demonstrated by simulating SOFC electrical efficiency as a function of operating voltage for in situ reforming of four different fuel mixtures, including steam reforming and partial oxidation of CH4, syngas, and pure CH4.
Titulo: Large limits of electrical efficiency in hydrocarbon fueled SOFCs
